column4: why is ffmpeg giving me "Unsupported codec for output stream #0.0" for output format mp3???
does anyone know why ffmpeg is giving me "Unsupported codec for output stream #0.0" for output format mp3???
ffmpeg is compiled without mp3 support
its a proprietaty format that puts restrictions on who distributes it
you can find custom builds of ffmpeg in ppa probably, and medibuntu repo provides everything you need to fork with mp

ok, sure, I get the free format thing or whatever..... but it's MP3.... the defacto audio standard for most everything... why would they take it out if they want to create an easy/seamless experience for users??
because the license does not allow redistributing it
I have no problem compiling my own thing... but other people might. I'm just puzzled as to why they would do that.
most people have no need for that, afaik medibuntu provides programs and mp3 support to deal with mp3
have a look at ubuntu-restricted-extras and medibuntu
ok, I will do that. thanks. Or, yeah, maybe I'll just use lame.
also regarding seamless, if ubuntu cannot play an mp3 it will tell you that it needs restricted stuff
lol. yeah, I guess the average users doesn't know what a terminal is.
oh crap... lame doesn't convert from flac? dang it.
i dont know anything about encoding/recoding
